div.p: Medical prescriptions (MPER XIII 7). Papyrus sheet (10.6 x 7.5 cm) fairly regularly cut off on all sides, except for the left margin, which is partly damaged. The verso preserves a recipe for the preparation of a tooth powder (see Orib., Syn., 3.172 [CMG 6.3, 109.8-10 Raed.], 178 [CMG 6.3, 109.6-8 Raed.], 5.25 [CMG 6.3, 163.12-9 Raed.]); on the recto, a documentary text from Hermoupolis (= SB XVI 12244). The script is a documentary hand assignable to the 4th cent. AD.

p.note: This papyrus has been digitally edited by Margherita Centenari as part of the Project "DIGMEDTEXT - Online Humanities Scholarship: A Digital Medical Library based on Ancient Texts" (ERC-AdG-2013, Grant Agreement no. 339828) funded by the European Research Council at the University of Parma (Principal Investigator: Prof. Isabella Andorlini). The digital edition is mostly based on the previous edition (H. Harrauer - P.J. Sijpesteijn, MPER XIII 7). Revised by Nicola Reggiani in the framework of the PRIN 2017 Project "Greek and Latin Literary Papyri from Graeco-Roman and Late Antique Fayum (4th BC – 7th AD): Texts, Contexts, Readers" funded by the Italian Ministry of Research (P.I. Prof. Lucio Del Corso, University of Cassino; Local Research Unit at the University of Parma, coordinator: Prof. Nicola Reggiani).

ξηρίον ὀδόντων λευκῶν καὶ ἀβρώτων·
ἁλὸς ἀμμωνιακοῦ δραχμὴ α
γληχῶνος δραχμαὶ β
ἴρεως δραχμὴ α
πεπέρεως κόκκουςκόκκους κ

item.p: This is the first attestation of the word ἄβρωτος on papyrus. "Contraraiment à H.-S. [= Harrauer-Sijpesteijn 1981= MPER 13.7] et à D.R. Jordan [= Jordan 1982], nous estimons que l'adj. ἄβρωτος ne signifie pas 'non attaqué par une carie', ma qu'il decrit l'effet non abrasif de la poudre sur les dents (comparer la recette de Galien, Comp.med.sec.loc. 5.4 [12, 889.7-9 K])" (Marganne 1983, 250).
